info.document:
A sprawling Hamptons estate had finally sold after eight years on the market, and a major price drop.

The property, known as the Pond House, has just sold for $26million, after originally being put on the market in 2009 for $39.5million.

The buyer, whose name has not been revealed, gets a full two-acre-estate, complete with a mansion and a separate guest cottage.

The sprawling main home is 12,000-square-feet and sits on two-acres of land next a 17-acre meadow preserve

Breathtaking views: This grand room has two fires places and overlooks the pool and pond

Sun and air: This open floor plan kitchen and dining area has floor to ceiling French doors

Marble flooring and gorgeous arched entryways are throughout on the main floor

A ground floor library-paneled in antique black walnut looks out over luscious greenery

The sprawling main house is 12,000-square-feet, overlooking Georgia Pond with 203-feet of water front viewing.

The main home has seven bedrooms and nine bathrooms, some of which are outfitted with hand-carved heated marble tubs.

The massive open floor plan kitchen and dining area is designed to allow maxium sunlight and outdoor air in as most of the perimeter has floor to ceiling French doors.

Stairway to the second level which which overlooks the main grand room

There are several second story positions which allow you to look down into the main floor below

A family room with fireplace overlooks the pool and pond with more French doors

Tranquility is a spa with recessed lighting, dimming capabilities and heated floors

A master bedroom with a fireplace and sweeping views of the pond and meadows

There is a grand room at the rear of the home with fire places on each side and two fully windowed stories overlooking the pool and pond.

The home features a beautiful carved stone fireplace, and the floors were created and installed by French craftsmen.

The raised property overlooking the pond has a infinity swimming pool and sits next to a 17-acre meadow preserve, which lends an added level of privacy to the lucky buyer.

Laced throughout the home is quarter-sewn white oak paneling, while the floors were created and installed by French craftsmen.

The house has a wraparound limestone porch, and outdoor dining area.

The wrap around porch offers 360-degree views of the two-acre property, pond and preserve

The infinity pool overlooks Georgica Pond and of course is outfitted with a hot-tub

The main home sits separate from the guest cottage which most anyone would be content to crash in

Charming next to its mansion neighbor, but the cottage has a full two bedrooms and everything else one needs

There is also a spa for extra measure.

The home is a Jeffery Coll√© design. All the stone floors have radiant heat. The home is fully pre-wired for home automation including lighting systems, multi-line phone systems, audiovisual and security.

The guest house is a 1,800 square foot cottage with two full bedrooms, a living room, kitchen and bath.

The property is the second most expensive to be sold this summer in the Hamptons, with the first being Hillary and Bill Clinton's estate, which went for just a few million more at $29million.
